title: Kenya women's national rugby union team
text:
The Kenya women's national rugby union team are a national sporting side of <a href="Kenya">Kenya</a>, representing them at <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>. The side first played in 2006.
History.
Kenya were runners-up at the <a href="Rugby%20Africa%20Women%27s%20Cup%232019%20Rugby%20Africa%20Women%27s%20Cup">2019 Rugby Africa Women's Cup</a> which also doubled as a <a href="2021%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20qualifying">World Cup qualifying</a> tournament. Despite their loss, the Lionesses still advanced to a cross-regional repechage play-off against <a href="Colombia%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Colombia</a>. However, their last chances of qualifying were dashed with a narrow 15 - 16 loss to Colombia in <a href="Nairobi">Nairobi</a>.
Results summary.
"(Full internationals only)"
Results.
"See <a href="Women%27s%20international%20rugby%23Status%20of%20internationals">Women's international rugby</a> for information about the status of international games and match numbering"
